jsky.science
Interface Wavelength1DModel

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.EventListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, ReplaceablePropertyChangeListener, ScienceObjectModel, ScienceObjectNodeModel
All Known Subinterfaces:
Spectrum
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractWavelength1D
public interface Wavelength1DModel
extends ScienceObjectNodeModel

Highest level interface for a one-dimensional list of quantity as a function of wavelength

toArrayData

public double[] toArrayData(Wavelength minWL,
                            Wavelength maxWL,
                            int nPts)
create list of double values containing list of data in the model. This list should match the wavelength data generated by toArrayWavelength If either wavelength is null, the model should provide a default minimum or maximum. Similarly, if the nPts is 0, then the model should provide a default number of points. These defaults should be consistent between the toArrayData() method and toArrayWavelengths()

toArrayData

public double[] toArrayData(double[] wavelengths)
create list of double values containing datavalues from the model at an array of wavelengths (specified in the default wavelength units)

toArrayWavelengths

public double[] toArrayWavelengths(Wavelength minWL,
                                   Wavelength maxWL,
                                   int nPts)
create list of double values containing list of wavelengths in the model. Use the wavelengths default units If either wavelength is null, the model should provide a default minimum or maximum. Similarly, if the nPts is 0, then the model should provide a default number of points. These defaults should be consistent between the toArrayData() method and toArrayWavelengths()

getNumPoints

public int getNumPoints()
returns the number of elements would return natively
